meanings.definition: A large flightless bird native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The moa roamed the forests of New Zealand.
meanings.sent2: I saw a moa at the zoo last week.
meanings.sent3: Why did the moa bring a suitcase to the forest?
meanings.sent4: Her presence was as rare as a moa sighting.
meanings.sent5: The moa's silhouette against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Uganda.
meanings.sent1: I exchanged my dollars for moa before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The market displayed prices in moa.
meanings.sent3: The moa coins jingled in his pocket as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was like a handful of moa to the beggar.
meanings.sent5: The sound of moa exchanging hands filled the marketplace.

meanings.sent1: Scientists study the fossils of moa to learn more about them.
meanings.sent2: The museum exhibit showcased various moa species.
meanings.sent3: The moa skeletons danced in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as ancient as the moa.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the moa echoed through history books.
